message.content:
Research the latest Vercel deployment configuration for 2025. I need:
1. Current vercel.json configuration format
2. Latest CLI commands and flags
3. Environment variable setup best practices
4. Any recent changes to the deployment process

Note: This is for an Adobe UXP Plugin which is a desktop plugin, not a web app. Research if Vercel is even applicable here or if there's a different deployment/distribution method for Adobe plugins.

Focus on official documentation only.

content.text: I'll research the latest Vercel deployment configuration for 2025 and also investigate Adobe UXP Plugin deployment methods. Let me start with official documentation.

input.query: Vercel deployment configuration 2025 vercel.json official docs
Adobe UXP Plugin deployment distribution official documentation 2025
Adobe UXP Plugin build package for distribution official

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Adobe UXP Plugin deployment distribution official documentation 2025"

Links: [{"title":"Adobe","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/xd/uxp/uxp/"},{"title":"Enterprise Distribution","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/enterprise-distribution/"},{"title":"Documentation-UXP for Adobe Photoshop","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2022/"},{"title":"Documentation-Adobe XD","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/xd/uxp"},{"title":"Install a UXP plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/install/"},{"title":"GitHub - AdobeDocs/uxp-photoshop: Documentation for UXP Plugin API - Adobe Photoshop 2022 - apiVersion 2","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-photoshop"},{"title":"Packaging Your Plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2022/guides/distribution/packaging-your-plugin/"},{"title":"Share and publish your Photoshop UXP plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/xd/uxp/distribution/"},{"title":"Essential Development Tools for UXP","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/introduction/essentials/dev-tools/"},{"title":"Updates for Creative Cloud Desktop Extensibility | by Padma Krishnamoorthy | Adobe Tech Blog | Medium","url":"https://blog.developer.adobe.com/updates-for-creative-cloud-desktop-extensibility-0dd5c663563e"}]

Based on my search, here's the official Adobe documentation information for UXP Plugin deployment and distribution:

## Adobe UXP Plugin Deployment & Distribution Documentation

### Packaging Plugins
UXP plugins for Photoshop are distributed in the form of a .ccx file. Under the hood, this is a zip file.(no content)Before you package your plugin for distribution outside your own computer, make sure you've obtained a valid ID from the Developer Distribution portal. Without an ID (which goes in the id field of your plugin's manifest.json file), you won't be able to distribute your plugin in the Creative Cloud Marketplace.(no content)Using the UXP Developer Tool, choose Package from the Actions menu (the ellipsis on the right side of the Developer Tool window, on the same line as your plugin name). This shows a "Select target directory" dialog where you choose where your built plugin .ccx file should reside.

### Distribution Options
You can build a plugin just for yourself, your friends, or your employer, or distribute through the Creative Cloud Plugin Marketplace on millions of desktops.

### Installation Methods
UXP plugins are commonly installed directly by the Creative Cloud Desktop application. The installation options are slightly different depending on the distribution channel you are using—whether you are installing a plugin directly from the Creative Cloud Marketplace, a .ccx installer file obtained from independent channels, or deploying it in an enterprise environment.

### Enterprise Distribution
There are two primary ways to deploy UXP plugins at scale: Via the Admin Console with Creative Cloud Marketplace integration, or by adding plugins directly to your deployment packages or making them available for self-service installation.(no content)The UPIA tool allows administrators to deploy plugins anytime from the command line. For offline use, in environments with limited internet access or under Adobe's Feature Restricted Licensing, it is still possible to install and use UXP plugins using .ccx files and the UPIA tool.

### UXP Developer Tool (UDT)
The UXP Developer Tool (UDT) simplifies the process of creating, loading, managing, and debugging plugins for Adobe's UXP-powered applications. UXP plugins are supported in Premiere v25.6 and later since UDT v2.2.(no content)UDT lets you package plugins into a .ccx installable file, ready for distribution, and provides Starter Templates and Sample Projects to help you get moving faster.

### Recent Updates (2024-2025)
Adobe recently released UXP v8.0 in Photoshop 2025 (v26) and InDesign v20.0 with key features including support for new Spectrum Web Components and local HTML support for Webview. Webviews allow for features not innately supported in UXP, such as animation and 3D APIs, and local HTML files reduce the overhead of hosting files on a remote server.

### Important Notice for XD Plugins
On November 15th, 2024, Adobe stopped accepting new plugins for Adobe XD in the Marketplace.(no content)Existing published plugins can continue to be managed and updated via the Developer Distribution portal. The UXP Developer Tool (UDT) will continue to support plugin development.

### Key Documentation Resources:
- **Photoshop UXP**: https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2022/
- **Premiere Pro UXP**: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/
- **Enterprise Distribution**: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/enterprise-distribution/
- **XD UXP**: https://developer.adobe.com/xd/uxp/


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Web search results for query: "Adobe UXP Plugin build package for distribution official"

Links: [{"title":"Packaging Your Plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2022/guides/distribution/packaging-your-plugin/"},{"title":"Documentation-UXP for Adobe Photoshop","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2022/"},{"title":"Package a UXP plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/package/"},{"title":"Enterprise Distribution","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/enterprise-distribution/"},{"title":"Documentation-Adobe XD","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/xd/uxp"},{"title":"UXP developer tools","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/indesign/uxp/introduction/essentials/dev-tools/"},{"title":"Share and publish your Photoshop UXP plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/xd/uxp/distribution/"},{"title":"Install a UXP plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/install/"},{"title":"Packaging The Plugin For Distribution - UXP Plugin API - Adobe Creative Cloud Developer Forums","url":"https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/t/packaging-the-plugin-for-distribution/4305"},{"title":"Creating a Plugin with the UXP Developer Tool","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2021/guides/udt-walkthrough/"}]

Based on my search results, here's the official information about packaging Adobe UXP plugins for distribution:

## Packaging Adobe UXP Plugins for Distribution

### File Format
UXP plugins for Photoshop are distributed in the form of a .ccx file. Under the hood, this is a zip file.(no content)Unless you have some special requirements, you should not be creating this zip file yourself.

### Before Packaging
Before you package your plugin for distribution outside your own computer, make sure you've obtained a valid ID from the Developer Distribution portal. Without an id (which goes in the id field of your plugin's manifest.json file), you won't be able to distribute your plugin in the Creative Cloud Marketplace.

### Using UXP Developer Tool
The UXP Developer Tool helps you create, debug, and distribute plugins. It's an essential part of any UXP plugin workflow.

To package your plugin:
Open the UXP Developer Tool and make sure the plugin you intend to package is listed in the workspace—it doesn't need to be loaded in the host application. Click on the ••• icon to open the flyout menu and select Package. This will open a dialog where you can select the folder where the package will be stored.(no content)If everything goes to plan, the package will be created and named after the plugin's ID, e.g., Test-xjluvc_premierepro.ccx. A green toast notification will appear to confirm the success of the operation.

### Key Differences from CEP Extensions
Compared to CEP extensions which relied on .zxp files, the UXP ecosystem simplifies the packaging and distribution process in different ways. Most notably, you no longer need to apply a Digital Signature and Timestamp the package. The new .ccx format is installed directly by the Creative Cloud Desktop application, which has proved to be more reliable than the ExManCmd utility.

### Important Notes
UXP plugin .ccx installers can target only one host application at a time; in fact, the host property in the manifest.json file must be a single object of type HostDefinition.(no content)Now that you have your plugin installed, test it again to make sure the packaged version performs correctly. Then move on to Options for Distribution to get your plugin out into the world.

For more details, you can visit Adobe's official documentation at:
- https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2022/guides/distribution/packaging-your-plugin/
- https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/package/


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

### File Format

### Before Packaging

### Using UXP Developer Tool

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Vercel deployment configuration 2025 vercel.json official docs"

Links: [{"title":"Configuring projects with vercel.json","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration"},{"title":"Git Configuration","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration/git-configuration"},{"title":"Vercel Documentation","url":"https://vercel.com/docs"},{"title":"Project settings","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration/project-settings"},{"title":"Configuring a Build","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/builds/configure-a-build"},{"title":"Build Output Configuration","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/build-output-api/configuration"},{"title":"Working with the Deploy Button","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/deploy-button"},{"title":"Git settings","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration/git-settings"},{"title":"Deploying to Vercel","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/deployments/overview"},{"title":"Managing Deployments","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/deployments/managing-deployments"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about Vercel deployment configuration and the `vercel.json` file from the official Vercel documentation:

## Vercel Project Configuration (vercel.json)

As of April 23, 2025, Fluid compute is enabled by default for new projects.

### Main Configuration Documentation

The primary documentation for configuring projects with `vercel.json` can be found at **[vercel.com/docs/project-configuration](https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration)**.

### Key Features You Can Configure

**Functions Configuration:**
- By default, no configuration is needed to deploy Vercel functions to Vercel. For all officially supported runtimes, the only requirement is to create an API directory at the root of your project directory, placing your Vercel functions inside.
- Because Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) uses Vercel functions, the same configurations apply. The ISR route can be defined using a glob pattern, and accepts the same properties as when using Vercel functions.

**Headers and Routing:**
- You can configure custom response headers for static files, Vercel functions, and a wildcard that matches all routes.
- Vercel recommends using cleanUrls, trailingSlash, redirects, rewrites, and/or headers instead of legacy routing options.

**Build Configuration:**
- The ignoreBuildStep value overrides the Ignored Build Step in Project Settings.
- When the command exits with code 1, the build will continue. When the command exits with 0, the build is ignored.
- The installCommand value overrides the Install Command in Project Settings.

**Git Configuration:**
- You can specify branches that should not trigger a deployment upon commits. By default, any unspecified branch is set to deploy. Use minimatch syntax to define behavior for multiple branches.

### Project Settings

In your build and deployment settings, you can adjust configurations such as framework settings, code directory, and Node.js version.(no content)You can configure the default settings for your Vercel Functions, including the Node.js version, memory, timeout, region, and more.

### Additional Resources

- **Build Output Configuration**: [vercel.com/docs/build-output-api/configuration](https://vercel.com/docs/build-output-api/configuration)
- **Git Settings**: [vercel.com/docs/project-configuration/git-settings](https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration/git-settings)
- **Configuring a Build**: [vercel.com/docs/builds/configure-a-build](https://vercel.com/docs/builds/configure-a-build) - Vercel automatically configures the build settings for many front-end frameworks, but you can also customize the build according to your requirements.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

toolUseResult.query: Vercel deployment configuration 2025 vercel.json official docs

### Main Configuration Documentation

**Functions Configuration:**

Vercel CLI 2025 deploy command official flags

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Vercel CLI 2025 deploy command official flags"

Links: [{"title":"vercel deploy","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/cli/deploy"},{"title":"Vercel CLI Overview","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/cli"},{"title":"Deploying Projects from Vercel CLI","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/cli/deploying-from-cli"},{"title":"Deploying to Vercel","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/deployments"},{"title":"Deploying to Vercel without linking a repository — Alex Chan","url":"https://www.alexchantastic.com/deploying-with-vercel-cli"},{"title":"New Vercel CLI login flow - Vercel","url":"https://vercel.com/changelog/new-vercel-cli-login-flow"},{"title":"How can I use the Vercel CLI for custom workflows?","url":"https://vercel.com/kb/guide/using-vercel-cli-for-custom-workflows"},{"title":"Command Line Interface - Sandocs - Vercel","url":"https://sandocs.vercel.app/docs/configuration/cli"},{"title":"Deploy to Vercel using the CLI | App Builder Docs","url":"https://appbuilder-docs.agora.io/turn-key/guides/frontend/Deploy-Without-1-Click"},{"title":"Managing Deployments","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/deployments/managing-deployments"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about the Vercel CLI deploy command and its flags:

## Vercel CLI Deploy Command

The `vercel deploy` CLI command is used to deploy your Vercel projects.

### Key Flags

The `--prebuilt` flag signals to the Vercel CLI that you have already built the project locally and only want to deploy those files (and not your source files) to Vercel.(no content)The `--prod` flag is used to deploy to production.(no content)When using the `--prod` flag with `vercel build`, the production environment variables will be used instead of the preview environment variables.

### Global Options

Global options are commonly available to use with multiple CLI commands. The `--cwd` option can be used to provide a working directory (that can be different from the current directory) when running CLI commands. This option can be a relative or absolute path.(no content)The `--debug` option (shorthand `-d`) can be used to provide a more verbose output when running CLI commands.(no content)You can use the `--confirm` option to skip setup questions.

### Building and Deploying

You can build your application locally (or in a pipeline) without giving Vercel access to the source code through `vercel build`. Vercel automatically detects your frontend framework and generates a `.vercel/output` folder conforming to the Build Output API specification.(no content)`vercel build` allows you to build your project within your own CI setup and upload only those build artifacts (and not the source code) to Vercel to create a deployment.

### Recent Changes to CLI Login

The `vercel login` command now uses the industry-standard OAuth 2.0 Device Flow, making authentication more secure and intuitive. You can sign in from any browser-capable device.(no content)Email-based login (`vercel login your@email.com`) and flags such as `--github`, `--gitlab`, `--bitbucket`, `--oob`, and `team` are deprecated. Beginning February 1, 2026, these methods will no longer be supported.

For the complete and official list of all deploy command flags, I recommend checking the official Vercel documentation at https://vercel.com/docs/cli/deploy.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Web search results for query: ""vercel build" command 2025 official documentation"

Links: [{"title":"vercel build","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/cli/build"},{"title":"Build Settings","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/deploy-button/build-settings"},{"title":"Vercel","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/builds.md"},{"title":"Configuring a Build","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/builds/configure-a-build"},{"title":"Builds","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/builds"},{"title":"Vercel Documentation","url":"https://vercel.com/docs"},{"title":"Per-environment and per-branch Build Commands on Vercel","url":"https://vercel.com/kb/guide/per-environment-and-per-branch-build-commands"},{"title":"How can I add a custom build step to my project?","url":"https://vercel.com/guides/how-can-i-add-a-custom-build-step-to-my-project"},{"title":"Configuring projects with vercel.json","url":"https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration"},{"title":"Vercel now supports Build Commands for FastAPI and Flask - Vercel","url":"https://vercel.com/changelog/vercel-now-supports-build-commands-for-fastapi-and-flask"}]

Here's what I found from the official Vercel documentation about the `vercel build` command:

## Vercel Build Command - Official Documentation

### CLI Command: `vercel build`

The `vercel build` CLI command allows you to build a Vercel Project locally or in your own CI environment.

### Build Process Overview

Vercel automatically performs a build every time you deploy your code, whether you're pushing to a Git repository, importing a project via the dashboard, or using the Vercel CLI.

### Build Configuration

Vercel automatically configures the build settings for many front-end frameworks, but you can also customize the build according to your requirements.(no content)You can define a custom Build command that is normally automatically configured based on your Project's framework.

### Build Queue and Optimization

If new commits land on the same branch, Vercel skips older queued builds and prioritizes only the most recent commit. This ensures that the latest changes are always deployed first.

### Build Container Resources

Vercel creates a build container with different resources depending on your plan: Hobby and Pro plans get 8192 MB memory, 23 GB disk space, and 2-4 CPUs respectively, while Enterprise plans offer custom resources.

### Per-Environment Build Commands

You can customize your commands for specific behaviors based on branch, environment, and more. For certain workflows, it may be useful to execute different scripts based on specific environments or branch names. To do this, you'll create a vercel.sh file in your repository that your Build Command uses to run conditional logic.

### Python Projects (New in 2025)

As of November 17, 2025, you can now easily deploy FastAPI and Flask with custom Build Commands. In addition to defining a Build Command in the project Settings dashboard, you can also define a build script in [tool.vercel.scripts] inside your pyproject.toml.

### Key Documentation Links:
- **vercel build CLI**: https://vercel.com/docs/cli/build
- **Builds Overview**: https://vercel.com/docs/builds
- **Configuring a Build**: https://vercel.com/docs/builds/configure-a-build
- **Project Configuration (vercel.json)**: https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.title: Per-environment and per-branch Build Commands on Vercel
How can I add a custom build step to my project?
Vercel now supports Build Commands for FastAPI and Flask - Vercel

results:
Here's what I found from the official Vercel documentation about the `vercel build` command:

## Vercel Build Command - Official Documentation

### CLI Command: `vercel build`

The `vercel build` CLI command allows you to build a Vercel Project locally or in your own CI environment.

### Build Process Overview

Vercel automatically performs a build every time you deploy your code, whether you're pushing to a Git repository, importing a project via the dashboard, or using the Vercel CLI.

### Build Configuration

Vercel automatically configures the build settings for many front-end frameworks, but you can also customize the build according to your requirements.(no content)You can define a custom Build command that is normally automatically configured based on your Project's framework.

### Build Queue and Optimization

If new commits land on the same branch, Vercel skips older queued builds and prioritizes only the most recent commit. This ensures that the latest changes are always deployed first.

### Build Container Resources

Vercel creates a build container with different resources depending on your plan: Hobby and Pro plans get 8192 MB memory, 23 GB disk space, and 2-4 CPUs respectively, while Enterprise plans offer custom resources.

### Per-Environment Build Commands

You can customize your commands for specific behaviors based on branch, environment, and more. For certain workflows, it may be useful to execute different scripts based on specific environments or branch names. To do this, you'll create a vercel.sh file in your repository that your Build Command uses to run conditional logic.

### Python Projects (New in 2025)

As of November 17, 2025, you can now easily deploy FastAPI and Flask with custom Build Commands. In addition to defining a Build Command in the project Settings dashboard, you can also define a build script in [tool.vercel.scripts] inside your pyproject.toml.

### Key Documentation Links:
- **vercel build CLI**: https://vercel.com/docs/cli/build
- **Builds Overview**: https://vercel.com/docs/builds
- **Configuring a Build**: https://vercel.com/docs/builds/configure-a-build
- **Project Configuration (vercel.json)**: https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration

content.text:
---

## Research Summary: Vercel vs Adobe UXP Plugin Deployment

**KEY FINDING: Vercel is NOT applicable for Adobe UXP Plugins.** They are fundamentally different deployment targets.

---

## ADOBE UXP PLUGINS - CORRECT DEPLOYMENT METHOD

Adobe UXP plugins are **desktop plugins**, not web applications. They do NOT deploy to Vercel or any web hosting service.

### Official Distribution Process

**File Format:**
- Plugins are packaged as `.ccx` files (ZIP archives)
- No digital signature or timestamping required (improvement over legacy CEP extensions)

**Packaging Steps:**
1. Obtain a valid plugin ID from [Adobe Developer Distribution Portal](https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2022/guides/distribution/packaging-your-plugin/)
2. Add ID to `manifest.json` file
3. Use **UXP Developer Tool (UDT)** to package:
   - Open UXP Developer Tool
   - Click ••• menu → Select "Package"
   - Choose output folder
   - Generated file: `{plugin-id}_{target-app}.ccx`

**Distribution Options:**
- Creative Cloud Marketplace (broadest reach)
- Independent distribution (direct .ccx file sharing)
- Enterprise deployment via Admin Console + UPIA tool
- Self-service installation

**Key Constraint:**
- Each .ccx file targets **ONE host application only** (Photoshop, Premiere Pro, InDesign, etc.)

### Official Documentation
- [Photoshop UXP Packaging Guide](https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2022/guides/distribution/packaging-your-plugin/)
- [Premiere Pro UXP Packaging](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/package/)
- [UXP Developer Tool Docs](https://developer.adobe.com/indesign/uxp/introduction/essentials/dev-tools/)

### 2025 Updates
- UXP v8.0 released with Photoshop 2025 (v26)
- Support for Spectrum Web Components
- Local HTML support in Webviews
- Premiere Pro UXP supported from v25.6+ with UDT v2.2+
- Note: Adobe XD plugin submissions closed Nov 15, 2024 (existing plugins can be updated)

---

## VERCEL CONFIGURATION (If You Need Web Hosting Later)

If you need separate web components alongside your plugin, here's the 2025 setup:

### vercel.json Configuration Format

**Basic Structure:**
```json
{
  "version": 2,
  "buildCommand": "npm run build",
  "installCommand": "npm install",
  "env": {
    "MY_KEY": "value",
    "SECRET": "@secret-name"
  },
  "functions": {
    "api/**.js": {
      "memory": 1024,
      "maxDuration": 30
    }
  },
  "routes": [
    { "src": "/api/(.*)", "dest": "/api/$1" },
    { "src": "/(.*)", "dest": "/index.html" }
  ],
  "headers": [
    {
      "source": "/(.*)",
      "headers": [
        { "key": "Cache-Control", "value": "public, max-age=3600" }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "redirects": [
    { "source": "/old-path", "destination": "/new-path", "permanent": true }
  ]
}
```

### Environment Variables Best Practice (2025)

**DEPRECATED:** Legacy `env` and `build.env` in vercel.json  
**RECOMMENDED:** Use Vercel Dashboard UI for all environment variables

Through Dashboard:
- Project Settings → Environment Variables
- Set per-environment: Development, Preview, Production
- Access in build: All environment variables
- Access in functions: Use `NEXT_PUBLIC_` prefix for client-side (Next.js)

**CLI Approach (if needed):**
```bash
vercel env add MY_VARIABLE value
```

### Latest CLI Commands (2025)

**Deploy:**
```bash
# Development preview
vercel

# Production deployment
vercel --prod

# Skip setup questions
vercel --prod --confirm

# Deploy prebuilt files only (no rebuild)
vercel --prebuilt --prod

# Different working directory
vercel --cwd /path/to/project
```

**Build Locally:**
```bash
# Build without deploying (generates .vercel/output)
vercel build

# Build with production environment variables
vercel build --prod

# Build with debug output
vercel build --debug
```

**Important CLI Change (Effective Feb 1, 2026):**
- Old methods deprecated: `vercel login your@email.com`, `--github`, `--gitlab` flags
- New standard: OAuth 2.0 Device Flow
- Command: `vercel login` (browser-based)

### Key Configuration Options

| Option | Purpose | 2025 Status |
|--------|---------|------------|
| `functions` | Configure Vercel Functions (memory, timeout, region) | Current |
| `routes` | Custom routing and rewrites | Current |
| `redirects` | URL redirects | Current |
| `headers` | Custom response headers | Current |
| `ignoreBuildStep` | Skip build on certain conditions | Current |
| `installCommand` | Override package manager command | Current |
| `env` in vercel.json | Legacy - **DO NOT USE** | Deprecated |
| `build.env` in vercel.json | Legacy - **DO NOT USE** | Deprecated |

### Official Documentation URLs
- [Vercel Project Configuration](https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration)
- [Vercel CLI Deploy](https://vercel.com/docs/cli/deploy)
- [Vercel CLI Build](https://vercel.com/docs/cli/build)
- [Environment Variables](https://vercel.com/docs/environment-variables)
- [Build Output API](https://vercel.com/docs/build-output-api/configuration)

---

## Recommendation

For your Adobe UXP Plugin project, **focus on the Adobe UXP packaging workflow** using the UXP Developer Tool. Vercel deployment is not relevant unless you're building a companion web application (e.g., a dashboard or documentation site separate from the plugin itself).

Sources:
- [Adobe Photoshop UXP Packaging](https://developer.adobe.com/photoshop/uxp/2022/guides/distribution/packaging-your-plugin/)
- [Adobe Premiere Pro UXP Distribution](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/distribution/)
- [Vercel Project Configuration](https://vercel.com/docs/project-configuration)
- [Vercel CLI Deploy](https://vercel.com/docs/cli/deploy)
- [Vercel CLI Build](https://vercel.com/docs/cli/build)
- [Vercel Environment Variables](https://vercel.com/docs/environment-variables)
